additional description: Calls were triggered using a playback device. The audio files include background noise files which took place reight before and after the vocalisations (so it serves as context). Up to 50m of distance.
capture device: Sennheiser ME67 microphone, Marantz PMD660 or 661 solid-state recorder
description:
Bird individual audio recordings (foreground and background) to accompany the
work:

_**" Automatic acoustic identification of individuals: Improving
generalisation across species and recording conditions"**_  
by Dan Stowell, Tereza Petruskova, Martin Šalek, Pavel Linhart

<https://royalsocietypublishing.org/doi/10.1098/rsif.2018.0940>

  
This dataset contains labelled recordings of individuals from three different
bird species:

  * Little owl
  * Chiffchaff
  * Tree Pipit

For more information, please see the README.txt file, and the research
article.

The dataset takes approx 11 GB of disk space after the ZIP files have been
uncompressed.
locality: northern Bohemia, Czech Republic (50°23′ N, 13°40′ E), and eastern Hungary (47°33′ N, 20°54′ E)
name: Little owl
recording period: sunset until midnight between March and April of 2013—2014
